newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent extends overnight gains, volume thin.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent extends overnight gains, volume thin.

text.p: Brent crude futures firmed on Friday as profit taking on the week's losses continued.
But brokers said overall sentiment remained bearish amid rising U.S. stocks and Iraqi crude exports.
January Brent last traded on SIMEX at $22.80 per barrel, up 28 cents from the London settlement. January Brent settled last Friday in London at $23.74.
Brokers said short covering was driving prices higher and the firmer tone was led by NYMEX crude trading on ACCESS.
NYMEX January crude was last traded at $23.95, up from the New York close of $23.72.
One broker said a chart gap on January Brent between $23.07 and $23.24 would be targetted by players, but he doubted the gap would be filled.
Turkey's Anatolian news agency said earlier on Friday that Iraqi oil was to be loaded onto a ship this weekend from Ceyhan for Turkey's state-owned company Tupras.
